title: Sri Lanka will decide on feasibility of project only
byline: Sri Lanka will decide on the acceptance of over US $ 62 million grant for the development of Kankesanthurai Port (KKS), depending on the business feasibility of the project only, Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Janitha Kodituwakku said yesterday.

title: Gary Anandasangaree appointed Canadian Public Safety Minister
byline: Tamil Canadian MP Gary Anandasangaree has been appointed today as the Minister of Public Safety in Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney’s new Cabinet.

title: Private security officers arrested over theft at Swiss Ambassador’s residence
byline: The Kollupitiya Police have arrested three individuals, including the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of a private security firm and another security officer, in connection with a theft at the official residence of the Swiss Ambassador in Colombo, where gold jewellery, including a diamond-studded ring and luxury wristwatches worth approximately Rs. 4.5 million were stolen from a safe.

title: Chickenpox vaccines out of stock amid rise in cases
byline: Amid a slight increase in chickenpox cases, the varicella vaccine that helps prevent the disease is currently out of stock at hospitals, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Trump pledges to lift Syria sanctions as he seals $142bn arms deal on Saudi visit
byline: President Donald Trump has said the US has ’’no stronger partner’’ than Saudi Arabia during his first major foreign trip - a whirlwind visit of Gulf countries mainly focused on shoring up investment.

title: Writ petition against Dr. Archchuna to be heard on June 26
byline: The writ petition filed seeking an order declaring that Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna is disqualified to be a Member of Parliament was today fixed for support on June 26 by the Court of Appeal.

title: Uruguay’s José Mujica, world’s ’poorest president’, dies
byline: Former Uruguayan President José Mujica, known as ’’Pepe’’, has died at the age of 89.

title: High blood pressure responsible for 70% of deaths in Sri Lanka
byline: High blood pressure is a leading cause of death in Sri Lanka accounting for approximately 70% of all fatalities nationwide, the Non-Communicable Disease (NCD) Unit of the Ministry of Health revealed.

title: Police launch night-time inspections to curb bus accidents
byline: In response to the recent surge in road accidents involving buses, police have stepped up night-time inspections of long-distance passenger buses in an effort to reduce such incidents.

title: Trump confirms Qatar gifted plane will serve as temporary Air Force One
byline: President Donald Trump confirmed that a luxury jet offered by the government of Qatar will serve as a temporary Air Force One, a move that has raised ethical and security concerns in Washington.

title: Several Dolphins wash ashore in Kalutara
byline: At least six dolphins were found washed ashore on Kalutara South beach, according to wildlife officials.

title: ICC World Test Championship Final 2025 squads
byline: South Africa and Australia put forward their 15-player squads for World Test Championship Final beginning on June 11 at Lord’s.

title: PHIs urge proper waste disposal after Dansals
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Association has urged organizers of recent dansals to properly dispose of the waste generated during these events.

title: SriLankan eyes five new aircraft including two narrow-bodies by 2026
byline: Sri Lanka’s loss-making national carrier, SriLankan Airlines, plans to add five new aircraft including two narrow-body planes to its fleet by March 2026, according to a top company official.

title: Nearly 20,000 Dengue cases reported this year
byline: The National Dengue Control Center (NDCC) has reported a total of 19,901 dengue cases across the country so far this year.

title: Microsoft to lay off 6,000 workers globally in cost-cutting move
byline: Microsoft on Tuesday said it was slashing unnecessary layers of management and seizing the benefits of new technology as reports said the tech behemoth was laying off thousands of workers.

title: Deadline announced for naming key Local Council officials
byline: Elections Commission Chairman R.M.A.L. Rathnayake has announced that political parties and independent groups have one week to provide the names of individuals selected for key positions in the local councils.
